alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Middlesex; New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 10 at 3:05PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Connecticut, including the following counties, eastern Fairfield, New Haven, and northern Middlesex. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 305 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. As of 3 PM, between 1/2 and 1 inch of rain had already fallen in spots. - Additional rainfall of 1/4 to 1/2 inch is expected. - Some locations that could experience minor flooding include... Bridgeport, New Haven, Meriden, Milford, Middletown, Wallingford, Shelton, Guilford, Colchester, East Hampton, Durham, Fairfield, Hamden, Stratford, Trumbull, Cheshire, Branford, Westport, North Haven and Seymour. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
